verses.text: And it came to pass, \add that\add* when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of the \sc Lord\sc* their God, \add for\add* which the \sc Lord\sc* their God had sent him to them, \add even\add* all these words;

then spake Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou speakest falsely: the \sc Lord\sc* our God hath not sent thee to say, Go not \add into\add* Egypt to sojourn there:

but Baruch the son of Neriah setteth thee on against us, for to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that \add they\add* might put us to death, and carry us away captives \add into\add* Babylon.
So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, obeyed not the voice of the \sc Lord\sc*, to dwell in the land of Judah.
But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah, that were returned from all nations, whither they had been driven, to dwell in the land of Judah:

\add even\add* men, and women, and children, and the king’s daughters, and every person that Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah.
So they came \add into\add* the land of Egypt: for they obeyed not the voice of the \sc Lord\sc*: thus came they \add even\add* to Tahpanhes.
Then came the word of the \sc Lord\sc* unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
Take great stones in thine hand, and hide them in the clay in the brickkiln, which \add is\add* at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;

and say unto them, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I \add will\add* send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.

And when he cometh, he shall smite the land of Egypt, \add and deliver\add* such \add as are\add* for death to death; and such \add as are\add* for captivity to captivity; and such \add as are\add* for the sword to the sword.

And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captives: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.
He shall break also the images of Beth-shemesh, that \add is\add* in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians shall he burn with fire.
